snippet: The deal, still tentative, for a 50-year lease to run the university’s parking lots is one of several steps by Ohio State to build its financial reserves as government support dwindles.
abstract: Ohio State University says that a private bidder has offered $483 million in a lump sum for a lease to operate the university parking facilities for 50 years; deal, which is not yet finalized, is one of several steps by the school to build its financial reserves as government support dwindles.
lead_paragraph: The deal, still tentative, for a 50-year lease to run the university’s parking lots is one of several steps by Ohio State to build its financial reserves as government support dwindles.

headline.seo: Ohio State Gets $483 Million Bid for Parking Lease
headline.main: Ohio State Gets $483 Million Bid for Parking Lease
headline.print_headline: Ohio State Gets $483 Million Bid for Parking Lease
